Owlhawk:  I do as I was ordered without question,
perhaps making a loud noice to give the animals a head
start on the fire.

--- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@...> wrote:
> She came nearer to him. She was not instinctively
> harsh or cruel, but 
> her tone showed that she was to be listened to.
> Owlhawk may be a 
> warrior, but she was more. She was a Wolf Warrior,
> and she had to 
> break him from the tactics and habits he was used to
> make him into 
> something more.
> 
> Katya: Neg. A Clan warrior that is not prepared,
> mentally or 
> physically is as good as the freebirth scum
> populating the bandit 
> caste. You must learn to be ready at all times.
> 
> She eased her tone. She had rebuked him, and now was
> the time to 
> instruct him.
> 
> Katya: The Clan rituals have two goals; the first
> one is honor. The 
> forces meeting in a Trial meet in a circle of
> equals. This way, we 
> fight zellbringen, single combat. I admit that
> necessity may prevent 
> us from always achieving single combat, but honor
> does not diminish 
> this way. The second reason for Trials is that it
> prevents waste. The 
> Clans have survived their birthing because they
> reduced wastes of 
> all kind to a minimum. Remember that. Now... What do
> you do if a 
> superior gives an order to raze a forest to make
> more place for a 
> military compound?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> wrote:
> > OOC:  Sorry I thought they were going to wait
> until
> > they talked to Rodimus.
> > 
> > BIC:  Owlhawk moved over and stood at attention in
> > front of her.
> > 
> > Owlhawk:  I assume to prepare your warrior both
> > mentally and physically for combat.
> > 
> > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > Katya: What are you doing, you freebirth slag?
> Move
> > > your circuits over 
> > > here! Tell me why you think ritual trials are
> > > important to us.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart
> <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > wrote:
> > > > Owlhawk was under the impression the
> conversation
> > > was
> > > > over and just leaned against the wall.
> > > > 
> > > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > Katya seemed happy of the decision.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Katya: Good. I will speak with Rodimus about
> > > this.
> > > > > If he does not want 
> > > > > me to train you, I will challenge him to a
> more
> > > > > serious trial.
> > > > > 
> > > > > She waited for Owlhawk's reaction.
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart
> > > <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > Owlhawk:  Allow me a moment to answer
> that.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > He once again goes inside his mind to
> speak
> > > with
> > > > > Owl.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Hawk:  What do you think?
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Owl:  Well, it might be refreshing to look
> at
> > > a
> > > > > > totally different state of mind that this
> > > training
> > > > > > would offer.  Besides they're not asking
> us to
> > > > > totally
> > > > > > give up being a Maximal.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Hawk:  Very well.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Back in the real world.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Owlhawk:  Very well.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...>
> wrote:
> > > > > > > Ragnar turned to Katya and nodded.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Ragnar: I will go and warn Rodimus of
> the
> > > > > outcome of
> > > > > > > this trial.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > He walks away, making the ground tremble
> > > > > slightly
> > > > > > > with every step.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Katya: He sees true in your potential.
> You
> > > are
> > > > > > > strong. However, being 
> > > > > > > a Clansman... err... Clansbot in your
> case,
> > > that
> > > > > is
> > > > > > > more than 
> > > > > > > techniques. It is a lot of training, and
> > > > > probably a
> > > > > > > major change of 
> > > > > > > minds. We Clans value zellbringen,
> single
> > > > > combat.
> > > > > > > Even in a melee, we 
> > > > > > > tend to engage no more than one enemy at

> > > > > > > above everything else in every aspect of

> > > > > > > politics, but that is easily answered
> > > through
> > > > > > > combat. Are you willing 
> > > > > > > to become a Clan Warrior?

> > > > > into
